reviews.review_msg: Thank you, Dr. Mishna. Dr. Mishna is really kind and friendly professor. The lectures were energetic thanks to the professor. This class was one of those few classes when you get to the end of the term, you'll start missing it that it's going to be finished soon. :(

Lets skip the prof. Why tf is Haggai as a TA again. The worst thing that Dr Mishna does is picking Haggai as a TA. He gives out 30% for the assignment again. His standard of marking assignments is just unreasonnable. I don't want to see Haggai in my life. Wish the school fire him. He doesn't even know what is math.

Dr. Mishna is definitely one of the better math profs at SFU. She is very passionate about the subject and that carries over into her teaching. She is very lenient when grading exams (and also grades the exams quickly!). Lectures sometimes felt disorganized and difficult to follow, but for the most part she is a clear and enthusiastic lecturer.

I dont like her at all. Every lecture she just copy at least 5 pages of notes. Notes are messy. She always talked to herself assume that is teaching. Exams was hard, tried to throw everything to us in one hour class. Hate Her!

The worst prof in SFU!! She just focus on some of those "PHYS" or "SUPER SCIENCE brain" students. The other students do not matter her at all. Even though our MT grade average are lower than 50%, it still dosn't give her any warning sign.

messy notes messy topics , hws are hard and no full solution posted, too much notes , approx 4-5 pages per hour, when u take 30s to think the previous sentence then you find another page of notes is done. lol
Decent prof, really into the course. Makes some mistakes on proofs that make it hard to follow, but encourages questions and takes the time to explain things.

Midterm was fair, but final was really hard, with basically all conceptual questions. He started off the semester explaining things well, but realized he was going too slow, so at the end, he crammed everything. But the end of the course is really interesting when you combine everything together :).

For the first half of the course he was a very good prof and explained things well, but in the latter half his explanations seemed to falter a little bit, especially in the taylor and laurent series sections. His tests were medium in difficulty but were fair. Overall, he was a good prof.
Hard exams and hw. If you are not really understand this guy, dont take his course

Good lecturer and tries explaining things in natural language instead of always using the straight textbook definition. Assignments were challenging but pretty similar to exams. Midterm was way too long for the given time (IMO), but the final was more fair. Gives optional quick pre-lecture exercises for bonus marks. Also accessible outside class.
lectures are fine no problems, hw can be long and difficult at times(hw is guided with steps), tests are long and will really push you

I would've given him a 3 or 4 if he posted his notes online. You're kind of screwed if you miss too many of his lectures so don't skip. He also seems to have a bit of an ego and is sometimes rude to students.

Had him for 251 also, and was able to achieve an A+ on both occasions. I don't like his notes, so I make my own (something the spoon fed babies below should do). Others are too harsh; HW and exams were excellent tests (but confusingly worded). I agree with the critics that he does have an ego; idk if this is justified, I have not seen his research.

Extremely disrespectful and  egotistical. He acts more or less like a condescending highschool teacher. Questions during office hours degrades into discussing his "philosophy". Lectures have no theoretical foundations and are disjoint from the homework, which is ambiguous and mathatically dubious at best. His incompetence is painfully apparent.

Majoring in Honours Pure Mathematics. Muraki has no understanding of the material, evident in lectures, notes, discussions in office hours, and homework assignments. Disrespectful, confrontational, egotistical, most likely a result of his inferiority complex as being applied "mathematician". Do SFU a favour and quit. You are a disgrace to Math.
cuts his office hour short without explaining- that says a lot

He posts solution videos that explain and walk through solutions, and he lectures well... but wait, there is more. His assignments are hard to understand. He only gives high-level help during office hours, and will leave you making mistakes. He gets frustrated easily if you do not "get it" quickly. Not the worst, but there are better.
It is a very difficult course but the stuff you learn is worth it! Assignments were fair, exams were difficult but the grading was ok.

This can be an extremely hard course, especially if you're not in mathematics. However, if you put the time in to understand the concepts, it will be very rewarding. However Muraki goes very fast and if you fall behind you have almost no hope of catching up. This is my second course with Muraki and he is still one of my favourite math profs.

Fair class, but with lots of work.  322 has same material as MATH 254 with an added layer of rigor, so you'll be already done a good deal of the course if you've taken 254.  As expected from any course of analysis (the study of being anal ;) ) Muraki is very strict about the fine print of theorems.
Nice professor but quite hard.
I think he's one of the most interesting math prof at SFU. I loved his digression on the history of math. If you hate him, that's because you aren't interested in math enough.

Professor Archibald is honestly one of the best professors I've had at SFU. You can clearly see his passion about math through his teaching. He made one of the midterms and the final on the tougher side, but I think he helps a lot with the homework. His lectures were straight from the textbook, but his explanations were very thorough.

I can say Dr. Choi is a reasonable Prof. His grading scheme is fair. He is accessible outside of class. He only tests you on material mentioned in the review session and nothing out of the ordinary. No suprises. His midterm was reasonable. Homework is sometimes hard sometimes easy. Lastly, he writes really fast so it may be hard to keep up

Stephen is very helpful during office hours and he will walk you through assignment questions to ensure you understand. He explains material very clearly and his assignments and tests are fair and he always lets you know everything on tests beforehand. He is very organized and carying. I hope I get to take classes with him in the future.

He is a great professor. homework assignments are easy and all tests follow directly from what we learned and during review sessions before test he tells you everything that will be on it. math 322 is pretty much calc 1 with complex #'s... super easy. he is also very helpful in office hours & his notes are organized. great prof.

He is definitely a nice prof, his assignments are fair, midterm is not easy but he gave a bonus question so you can still get good marks, and if you did the online assignments well you get bonus marks on final.
This class was VERY well organized and he gave us everything we needed to succeed. My only minor complaint is that he writes a lot of notes very quickly and it can make lectures a little dry.

Dr. Choi writes and teaches at sonic speed, yet with crystal clarity.  He explains abstract notions (and everything else) in very accessible terms.  Very helpful, nice, and available, too.  He's a great teacher, and one of the best profs at S.F.U., without question.

Wonderful prof.  Kept things straight forward and never asked anything unreasonable.  Midterm was extremely easy and final wasn't too difficult.  Take a class with him if you want to really understand the material and get a good grade.

Very friendly professor. Math is hard, but I never feel helpless in his class. Good prepare lecture and review section be4 exams. Math dep. should give him a bigger office because too many students go to his OH. I wish he will teach some 400 level course.

Midterm too easy, I lost my interest in the course.  HW are straight from the text, again too easy.  What it means is the final is the deciding factor.  Bad!  Everything else about this prof is good.  Oh, please turn students down when they come for advising during 322 office hours.
Dr. Choi has definitely improved his teaching style over the semesters. He also is incredibly helpful and his exams are straight forward.
